item.title: Chaperones
item.description:
• How do molecular chaperones recognize their substrate proteins?
  • What mechanisms regulate the activity of molecular chaperones?
  • How do disease-causing mutations and post-translational modifications remodel the conformational landscapes?

Molecular chaperones maintain cellular homeostasis by binding to and stabilizing partially or completely unfolded proteins. By preventing unwanted protein aggregation mediated by exposed hydrophobic residues, molecular chaperones can …
